description.value:
Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) are increasingly being recognized as essential factors that influence healthcare outcomes. This HL7 Implementation Guide (IG) defines how to exchange SDOH content defined by the Gravity Project using the Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR) standard. It defines how to represent coded content used to support the following care activities: screening, clinical assessment/diagnosis, goal setting, and the planning and performing of interventions. This IG addresses the need to gather SDOH information in multiple settings, share that information between stakeholders, and exchange referrals between organizations to address specific social risk needs, all with appropriate patient consent. In addition, the IG demonstrates how to share clinical data to support secondary purposes such as population health, quality, and research. The guide supports the following use cases: * Document SDOH data in conjunction with the patient encounters with providers, payers, and community services * Document and track SDOH related interventions to completion * Identify cohorts of individuals that have a common relationship to another entity (e.g., covered by the same payer)
This implementation guide was developed by the Gravity Project, which specifically focuses on using HL7 FHIR to define standards for the exchange of SDOH-related information. Both the project and this implementation guide are focused on the U.S. environment. This implementation guide leverages content from the US Core implementation guide and binds to US-specific terminology. However, the basic constructs and interaction patterns may well be applicable outside the U.S.
### Content and organization
The implementation guide is organized into the following sections:
* Background: Includes [Gravity Background](gravity_background.html), [SDOH Clinical Care Scope](sdoh_clinical_care_scope.html), [Functional Use Cases](functional_use_cases.html), and [Technical Background](technical_background.html), that describe the environment in which this implementation guide establishes standards for information exchange * Context: Describes the [Survey Instrument Support](survey_instrument_support.html),[ QuestionnaireResponse Mapping Instructions](mapping_instructions.html), [Support for Multiple Domains](support_for_multiple_domains.html), and [Exchange Workflow diagram](exchange_workflow.html) that describes a high-level overview of expected process flow * Specifications: Provides a overview of the [FHIR Artifacts](fhir_artifacts_overview.html) defined and used in this IG, description of [Privacy and Security](privacy_and_security.html) issues, and explains [MustSupport and Missing Data](mustsupport_and_missing_data.html) concepts * [Downloads](downloads.html): Provides for the download of various IG related artifacts * [Credits](credits.html): Identifies the individuals and organizations involved in developing this implementation guide * [Artifacts Index](artifacts.html): Introduces and provides links to the FHIR R4 profiles, examples and other FHIR artifacts used in this implementation guide
### Note to Implementers
Implementers should pay specific attention to the following sections:
* [Technical Background](technical_background.html) if the implementer needs basic FHIR information references * [Survey Instrument Support](survey_instrument_support.html), and [ QuestionnaireResponse Mapping Instructions](mapping_instructions.html) if implementing support for structured assessment instruments * [Support for Multiple Domains](support_for_multiple_domains.html) to understand this IG's approach to domain specific value sets * [Exchange Workflow diagram](exchange_workflow.html) to understand the exchange workflows * [FHIR Artifacts](fhir_artifacts_overview.html) to understand the individual FHIR artifacts described in this IG * [Privacy and Security](privacy_and_security.html) for implementers that are concerned with privacy and security aspects related to implementing the information exchanges defined in this IG * [MustSupport and Missing Data](mustsupport_and_missing_data.html) to understand the interpretation of the MustSupport flags and the treatment of Missing Data used in this IG * [Artifacts Index](artifacts.html) all implementers need to understand the FHIR R4 profiles, examples and other FHIR artifacts defined in this implementation guide and linked from this section * [Downloads](downloads.html) links to allow implementers to download the IG and various artifacts
New updates Includes all changes as of 11/4/2021 4:28 pm CT
Profile for Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) conditions.
Profile for consent related to the release of Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) information to non-HIPAA covered organizations.
Profile for goals that address Social Determinants of Health (SDOH).
Profile for identifying groups of patients who have a Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) condition and are members of a specific payer organization.
Profile that describes the means by which a healthcare service can be contacted.
Profile that describes address information for a healthcare service.

Profile for Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) observations that involve assessment (e.g., by a provider or payer) as opposed to being derived only from screening surveys (as is the case for the SDOHCC Screening Response Observation). The Cross-Group Projects work group granted an exception to US Core on 06/10/2021 - Jira ticket 32892.
Profile for observations about ethnicity using Office of Management and Budget (OMB) ethnicity category codes and CDC ethnicity codes. This profile is intended for draft use only.
Profile for observations about race using Office of Management and Budget (OMB) race category codes and CDC race codes. This profile is intended for draft use only.

Profile for observations that represent question and answer pairs from Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) screening instruments that are represented in LOINC. The Cross-Group Projects work group granted an exception to US Core on 12/03/2020 - Jira ticket 29795.
Profile for interventions that address Social Determinants of Health.
Profile for service requests that address Social Determinants of Health.
Profile for SDOH-related tasks to be carried out by the patient or someone acting on their behalf.
Profile for tasks requesting fulfillment of an SDOHCC ServiceRequest (i.e. referral for service) and subsequently tracking and managing the fulfillment of that referral.
Codes for the status of a screening response observation.
Codes that represent Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) domains.
A local code system defined within the context of the SDOH-CC IG.
An example of a Consent for information disclosure related to SDOH information.
An example of a food security Goal that addresses a food insecurity Condition.

display.value: SDOHCC Group SDOH Patients For Payer Example

name.value: SDOHCC Group SDOH Patients For Payer Example

description.value: An example of Group for patients that have any SDOH condition and are members of a specific payer organization.

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Assessment Social Isolation Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Assessment Social Isolation Example

description.value: An example of a social isolation Observation that is not necessarily derived only from a screening survey. This observation involves additional assessment (e.g., by a provider, payer, etc.). This example also includes an Observation.category (i.e., Social Connection) that, at the time the example was added to the IG, was not yet in the “SDOHCC ValueSet SDOH Category”. The example illustrates that categorization is possible using category codes that may not yet be included in the SDOHCC ValueSet SDOH Category (which will continue to be expanded as the Gravity Project continues to develop SDOH terminology content).

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Assessment Inadequate Food Intake Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Assessment Inadequate Food Intake Example

description.value: An example of an inadequate food intake Observation that is not necessarily derived only from a screening survey. This observation involves additional assessment (e.g., by a provider, payer, etc.).

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Assessment Transport Too Expensive Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Assessment Transport Too Expensive Example

description.value: An example of a transportation Observation that is not necessarily derived only from a screening survey. This observation involves additional assessment (e.g., by a provider, payer, etc.). This example also includes an Observation.category (i.e., Transportation Insecurity) that is included in the “SDOHCC ValueSet SDOH Category”. Additionally, a subcategory of Transportation Insecurity (i.e., Transportation Insecurity Financial) is included to illustrate that it is possible to further subcategorize a “SDOHCC ValueSet SDOH Category” code with a code that is not in the ValueSet.
An example of a payer organization. This example is used as the referenced organization in other SDOHCC examples.
An example of a patient. This example is used as the referenced organization in other SDOHCC examples.

display.value: SDOHCC Procedure Food Pantry Application Assistance Example

name.value: SDOHCC Procedure Food Pantry Application Assistance Example

description.value: An example of a completed Procedure for assistance with applying to a food pantry that is based on a ServiceRequest and references as its reason a food insecurity Condition.
A Questionnaire instance that represents the questions and answers from the LOINC Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire (LOINC code 88121-9).

display.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Active Food Pantry Application Assist Example

name.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Active Food Pantry Application Assist Example

description.value: An example of an active ServiceRequest for assistance with applying to a food pantry that references as its reason a food insecurity Condition.

display.value: SDOHCC QuestionnaireResponse Hunger Vital Sign Example

name.value: SDOHCC QuestionnaireResponse Hunger Vital Sign Example

description.value: An example of an SDC QuestionnaireResponse that represents questions and selected answers from the LOINC Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire (LOINC code 88121-9). The example is generated using the LHC-Forms SDC Questionnaire App.

A StructureMap instance that represents the resource that transforms specific questions and answers from the LOINC Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire (LOINC code 88121-9) into their corresponding Observations (SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Q1 Example, SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Q2 Example, and SDOHCC Observation response Hunger Vital Sign Q3 Example) and derived Condition (SDOHCC Condition Food Insecurity Example).

display.value: SSDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Grouping Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Grouping Example

description.value: An example of an Observation grouping that has as its members the 3 Observations generated from the LOINC Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire (LOINC code 88121-9).

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Question 1 Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Question 1 Example

description.value: An example of a screening response Observation that represents the first question (LOINC code 88122-7) and answer from the Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] screening questionnaire represented in LOINC.

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Question 2 Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Question 2 Example

description.value: An example of a screening response Observation that represents the second question (LOINC code 88123-5) and answer from the Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] screening questionnaire represented in LOINC.

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Question 3 Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response Hunger Vital Sign Question 3 Example

description.value: An example of a screening response Observation that represents Food insecurity risk [HVS] (LOINC code 88124-3) from the Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire (LOINC code 88121-9). This Observation is derived from the two Observations generated from the first two questions in the Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire. This Observation does not have an Observation.performer because Food insecurity risk [HVS] is derived as opposed to answered directly on the questionnaire.
An example of a food insecurity Condition (a health concern) that references, as evidence, Observations derived from the LOINC Hunger Vital Sign [HVS] questionnaire (88121-9).
A Questionnaire instance that represents the questions and answers from the PRAPARE questionnaire represented in LOINC (code 93025-5).

An example of an SDC QuestionnaireResponse that represents questions and selected answers from the PRAPARE questionnaire represented in LOINC (code 93025-5). The example is generated using the LHC-Forms SDC Questionnaire App.

A StructureMap instance that represents the resource that transforms specific questions and answers from the PRAPARE questionnaire represented in LOINC (code 93025-5) into their corresponding Observations and derived Conditions (health concerns).

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Response PRAPARE Employment Status Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response PRAPARE Employment Status Example

description.value: An example of a screening response Observation that represents a question and answer related to employment status from the PRAPARE questionnaire represented in LOINC.

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Response PRAPARE Housing Status Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response PRAPARE Housing Status Example

description.value: An example of a screening response Observation that represents a question and answer related to housing status from the PRAPARE questionnaire represented in LOINC.

display.value: SDOHCC Observation Response PRAPARE Unmet Needs Multiselect Example

name.value: SDOHCC Observation Response PRAPARE Unmet Needs Multiselect Example

description.value: An example of a screening response Observation that represents a PRAPARE question represented in LOINC that allows more than one answer. In this case, the LOINC question is used for Observation.code and for Observation.component.code. Observation.value is omitted. Answers, whether multiple or single (including exceptions and flavors of null), are represented using Observation.component.value.
An example of a Condition (a health concern) that is based on an Observation related to employment status that is derived from a QuestionnaireResponse to PRAPARE (represented in LOINC).
An example of a homelessness Condition (a health concern) that is based on an Observation related to housing status that is derived from a QuestionnaireResponse to PRAPARE (represented in LOINC).

display.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Fulfillment Completed Example

name.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Fulfillment Completed Example

description.value: An example of a completed Task For Referral Management that has a ServiceRequest for assistance with applying to a food pantry as the Task.focus and a Procedure for assistance with applying to a food pantry as the Task.output.

display.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Subtask Completed Example

name.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Subtask Completed Example

description.value: An example of a completed Task For Referral Management that delegates responsibility to fulfill a referral from an intermediary organization to another organization (e.g., when a Coordination Platform receives a Task from a referral source and passes it on to a Community Based Organization).

display.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Subtask Accepted Example

name.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Subtask Accepted Example

description.value: An example of an accepted Task For Referral Management that delegates responsibility to fulfill a referral from an intermediary organization to another organization (e.g., when a Coordination Platform receives a Task from a referral source and passes it on to a Community Based Organization).
Extension for flagging a HealthcareService.telecom as one the patient can use to make an appointment.
Codes for the priority of a task for a patient.
Codes that represent categories of Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) questionnaires.
Codes for the status of a task for a patient.
Codes for the general action a task involves.

display.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Fulfillment Accepted Example

name.value: SDOHCC Task Referral Management Order Fulfillment Accepted Example

description.value: An example of an accepted Task For Referral Management that has as the Task.focus a ServiceRequest for assistance with applying to a food pantry.
An example of a clinic organization.
An example of a coordination platform organization.

display.value: SDOHCC Practitioner Dr Jan Water Example

name.value: SDOHCC Practitioner Dr Jan Water Example

description.value: An example of a practitioner.

display.value: SDOHCC Practitioner Role Dr Jan Water Example

name.value: SDOHCC Practitioner Role Dr Jan Water Example

description.value: An example of a practitioner in a role of family medicine physician.

display.value: SDOHCC Task Patient Risk Questionnaire Completed Example

name.value: SDOHCC Task Patient Risk Questionnaire Completed Example

description.value: An example of a completed Task For Patient where the task was to complete a Hunger Vital Signs questionnaire (a questionnaire of the category ‘risk questionnaire’).
Codes for the reason an observation does not have a value.

name.value: DELETE SDOHCC ValueSet OMB Race Categories

description.value: Codes for the five Office of Management and Budget (OMB) race categories but without the'Unknown' and 'Asked but no answer' codes that were included in the US Core OMB Race Categories valueset.
An example of a patient ethnicity Observation where the ethnicity is Hispanic or Latino (detailed as part Cuban, and part Puerto Rican).
An example of a patient race Observation highlighting all elements and repetitions where possible.
An example of a health care service with telecom(s) that can be used to make an appointment flagged.
An example of a location used for a healthcare service that the patient might want to schedule an appointment at.

display.value: SDOHCC Task Patient Make Appointment Completed Example

name.value: SDOHCC Task Patient Make Appointment Completed Example

description.value: An example of a completed Task For Patient where the task was to make an appointment.

display.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Completed Food Pantry Application Assist Example

name.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Completed Food Pantry Application Assist Example

description.value: An example of a completed ServiceRequest for assistance with applying to a food pantry that references as its reason a food insecurity Condition.

display.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Subreferral Summer Food Program Example

name.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Subreferral Summer Food Program Example

description.value: An example of a completed, original-order ServiceRequest (i.e., SDOHCC Service Request Active Food Pantry Application Assist Example) that is based on a Service Request to an intermediary organization (e.g., a Coordination Platform) that then created this Service Request (i.e., Assistance with application for Summer Food Service Program) to be fulfilled by a Community Based Organization.

display.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Subreferral Garden Program Example

name.value: SDOHCC ServiceRequest Subreferral Garden Program Example

description.value: An example of a completed, original-order ServiceRequest (i.e., SDOHCC Service Request Active Food Pantry Application Assist Example) that is based on a Service Request to an intermediary organization (e.g., a Coordination Platform) that then created this Service Request (i.e., Assistance with application for garden program) to be fulfilled by a Community Based Organization.
This value set includes all of the 211 LA County Taxonomy.

display.value: SDOHCC Procedure Provision Of Food Example

name.value: SDOHCC Procedure Provision Of Food Example

description.value: An example of a completed Procedure where Procedure.code.coding includes a SNOMED CT code for ‘Provision of food’ and a more specific LA 211 Taxonomy code for “Thanksgiving Baskets’.

display.value: SDOH Clinical Care Referral Recipient - Light

name.value: SDOH Clinical Care Referral Recipient - Light

description.value: This resource describes the required and desired behavior of systems acting as 'light-weight' SDOH clinical care 'referral recipients'.
This resource describes the required and desired behavior of systems acting as SDOH clinical care 'coordination platforms' (CPs).
This resource describes the required and desired behavior of systems acting as SDOH clinical care 'referral recipients'.
This resource describes the required and desired behavior of systems acting as SDOH clinical care 'referral sources'.
This value set contains all of LOINC and SNOMED CT.
